medical_history.chief_complaint: Mr R had a cough and trouble recovering, leading to difficulty sleeping horizontally.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Mr R's symptoms began in 1991 when he could no longer sleep horizontally. Initially diagnosed with NYHA class II to III heart failure, his condition progressed, resulting in an ejection fraction below 35%. By 1999, he experienced more severe symptoms such as resting tachycardia and Cheyne-Stokes respirations, leading to NYHA class III to IV symptoms. Symptoms continued to worsen despite treatment until he accepted hospice care, after which he began adhering to his medication and diet, resulting in improvement.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Mr R has idiopathic cardiomyopathy and type 2 diabetes mellitus.
medical_history.social_history: Mr R is a retired professional who emigrated to the United States in the 1950s.
